results.title: The Hands
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
This pantomime, performed by Marcel Marceau is an allegory of good and evil. The struggle between them is revealed by the force of the hands through symbolic movements. Assisted by Pierre Verry. Introduced by Marcel Marceau. Music by the Russian Cathedral Orthodox Choir, Paris.

results.title: Bip hunts butterflies
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Tragic comic mime by Marcel Marceau in which his character Bip discovers how fragile life can be - as is the fragile butterfly held in his hands. His concern for the dying butterfly is expressed with a range of emotional responses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Barnes, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes Productions

results.title: The Cage (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Allegorical pantomime performed by Marcel Marceau showing a person struggling to escape from confinement- an enclosure of invisible walls. Marceau’s groping movements and final breakthrough, only to find another invisible wall, express mankind’s continuing struggle for enlightenment. Marceau believes that “we have but to walk out of the cage”. Also features his partner Pierre Verry. Suitable for upper secondary school level.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.

results.title: The Painter
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Mime makes the invisible visible and the visible invisible. Marceau’s sometimes comical - but always graceful - interpretation of The Painter in Central Park allows the viewer to “see” objects which are not there.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.

results.title: Youth, maturity, old age and death
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
In four minutes, and not moving from one spot, Marceau expresses the seven-ages-of-humankind, beginning with life emerging from a mother’s womb, through the cycle of life, to the grave. Marceau believes “this pantomime reveals, maybe the best of what mime can do in condensing time.”
results.description:

results.title: The Greatest man in the world
results.creator_credit: Ralph Rosenblum, Ed Lynch and Learning in Focus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
An adaptation of a James Thurber story featuring Brad Davis, Carol Kane and Howard da Silva. The first man to fly solo and non-stop around the world is an illiterate and incorrigible lout. Attempts by newsmen and high government officials to present him as a hero fail dismally. Teleplay by Jeff Wanshel. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Mark Twain's 'The man that corrupted Hadleyburg'
results.creator_credit: Ralph Rosenblum, Christopher Lucas and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Based on the story of the same title by Mark Twain, about a small town visited by a stranger who concocts a scheme to test the honesty of the town’s leading citizens. Stars Robert Preston, hosted by Henry Fonda.

results.title: The Sky is gray
results.creator_credit: Stan Lathan, Whitney Green and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Based on a short story by Ernest Gaines. Deals with a young black farmboy’s visit to the dentist in a small Louisiana town in the 1940’s. The visit marks the dawning of his social and self-awareness. Commentary by Henry Fonda. Cast: Olivia Cole, James Bond III.

results.title: The Boarded window
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
This film is based on the famous horror story by Ambrose Bierce. It tells of a hunter whose young wife dies of fever. Her grief stricken husband prepares her body for burial, but during the night the forces of nature intervene to create a horrific and macabre ending. Restricted : postprimary schools only.
